title: Equilibrium P when initial HI doubled

content.description: <math alttext="2 H I gas is in equilibrium with H 2 gas plus I 2 gas; K sub p is equal to the fraction P sub H 2 times P sub I 2 over P sub H I squared, which equals 0.0016" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HI(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.0016</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The decomposition of <math alttext="H I gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="298 Kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equilibrium equation above. When <math alttext="100 decimal point torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H I gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a previously evacuated, rigid container and allowed to reach equilibrium, the partial pressure of <math alttext="I 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is approximately <math alttext="3.7 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is increased to <math alttext="200 decimal point torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the process is repeated at the same temperature, which of the following correctly predicts the equilibrium partial pressure of <math alttext="I 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub I 2 is approximately equal to 14 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>14</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is directly proportional to the square of the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="P sub I 2 is approximately equal to 0.073 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>0.073</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is inversely proportional to the square of the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="P sub I 2 is approximately equal to 7.4 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>7.4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is directly proportional to the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="P sub I 2 is approximately equal to 1.9 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.9</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is inversely proportional to the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub I 2 is approximately equal to 7.4 torr" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>7.4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>torr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is directly proportional to the initial pressure of <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
